body:
Code Review questions have been designed to give candidates a real-world task - review the code written by someone else and provide feedback on it. This task is ideal for more senior-level candidates who are expected to have existing industry experience. They may be managers, mentors, or simply contributing members of a high performing team.

Code Review questions are manually graded, as there is no automated way to read the feedback or judge their expertise. However, written comments from the candidate can provide a really good signal of their seniority and experience in a relatively short amount of time for the candidate.Â 

How to add Code Review questions to a test

To add a Code Review question, follow these steps:

  1. Create a new test or open an existing test
  2. Add a question from the library
  3. Select Code Review in the Type search area
